summary: This is a search and seizure warrant issued by the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York, authorizing the forensic search of compact discs seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence. The warrant seeks evidence related to violations of sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy, including communications, photographs, videos, and records related to victims and potential victims.

persons.name: Barbara Moses
persons.context: Issued the search and seizure warrant for the forensic examination of evidence seized from Epstein's residence.

events.title: Seizure of evidence from Epstein's New York residence
events.description: Compact discs stored in containers marked with FBI evidence numbers 15, 16, 17, 18, and 22 were seized from the residence at 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY.

events.title: Deadline for warrant execution
events.description: The search warrant must be executed on or before this date, as commanded by the court.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, New York
keyFacts: The warrant authorizes a forensic search of compact discs seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence on July 7, 2019.
The search is for evidence of violations of Title 18, U.S. Code, Sections 1591 (sex trafficking of minors) and 371 (conspiracy).
Items to be seized include communications regarding victims, photographs of teenage girls, videos of minors in sexually explicit conduct, and child erotica.
The warrant allows law enforcement to use various forensic techniques including file review, scanning for deleted data, and keyword searches.
The warrant was issued by U.S. Magistrate Judge Barbara Moses and had to be executed by July 21, 2019.
